title: 113_hr3557
content: The Act is titled the "Reasonable Expectation of American Privacy Act of 2013" or the "REAP Act of 2013." It includes increased protections for voluntary disclosure of password information. Section 2702 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include increased protections for voluntary disclosure of password information by a person or entity providing an electronic service. Section 2702 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include protections for electronic service providers from disclosing password information of subscribers or customers, with exceptions outlined in subsection (d). Section 2702 of title 18, United States Code, outlines protections for electronic service providers regarding the disclosure of password information of subscribers or customers, with specific exceptions detailed in subsection (d). Increased protections are being implemented regarding the required disclosure of customer communications and password information. The amendment to Section 2703 of title 18, United States Code, allows governmental entities to require disclosure of password information from electronic communication or remote computing service providers only with a warrant. The amendment to Section 2703 of title 18, United States Code, allows disclosure of password information with a warrant, and makes conforming amendments to Chapter 121 of title 18, United States Code. SEC. 4. Password information excluded from transactional records available through a counterintelligence request. Section 2709 of title 18, United States Code, amended to prohibit requests for password information in electronic communication transactional records. SEC. 5. Password information excluded from tangible things required to be produced through a FISA court order. Section 501(a)(1) of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 is amended to exclude password information related to customers or subscribers of electronic communication or remote computing services from the list of tangible things that can be obtained.
